question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Entering this study abroad program, I anticipated immersing myself in Spanish culture and cuisine. However, I soon discovered that our exploration went beyond surface-level understanding. We delved deep into the authentic essence of being Spanish, unveiling a fascinating tapestry of migration and diverse identities within Spain. Through this enlightening perspective, we engaged in thought-provoking discussions about Madrid's historical ties to slavery and the impact of the Franco regime. Moreover, I gained practical skills, such as effectively using social media platforms like Instagram to share my Spanish experiences through captivating narratives. Yet, the most impactful aspect of this course was its focus on identity and the struggles faced by immigrants from around the world as they search for their place within Spain's vibrant mosaic.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

The class had light readings everyday so even while abroad there wasn't a heavy workload which allowed the class to feel manageable and fun.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The Instagram video project was a lovely way to engage creatively and critically with my study abroad experience. I would keep it but, perhaps, make it more of an individual, journal-like chronicle. Although I really liked working with my group (they were fantastic!), I think the project would have been a bit more impactful if it had been a reflection of my experiences and thoughts on Madrid. I also think the class visits to other Spanish cities and important locations around Madrid were incredibly important to my positive experience.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The learning environment in this class was exceptionally conducive to my educational journey, thanks to the instructors and the well-designed structure of the course. The instructors played a pivotal role in facilitating my learning by creating an engaging and inclusive atmosphere that encouraged active participation and critical thinking. One notable aspect of the course that greatly contributed to my learning was the incorporation of diverse course components. The combination of lectures, discussions guest speakers, and interactive activities allowed for a comprehensive exploration of the subject matter. The instructors skillfully curated a curriculum that balanced theoretical knowledge with real-world examples, fostering a deeper understanding of the topics at hand. Additionally, the course incorporated interactive methods of instruction, such as group projects and multimedia (instagram and video). These approaches not only made the learning experience more dynamic but also encouraged collaboration and the application of theoretical concepts to practical situations. By actively engaging with the material, I was able to develop a deeper level of comprehension and retain the information more effectively. Additionally, the professors fostered an atmosphere that encouraged students to express their thoughts and emotions openly, even if they were uncomfortable or conflicted. Through this approach, we were able to explore contrasting viewpoints and grapple with the complexities of the subject matter, deepening our understanding and promoting personal growth.The professors skillfully navigated through difficult and potentially controversial topics, such as the historical legacy of slavery in Madrid and the complex regime of Francisco Franco.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Definitely take it. You learn so much, you do so much. By your last day, you will have gotten so close to your classmates and the profs as well.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: This class is worth taking as a study abroad course because it was a nice balance of academic work but did not take over your entire experience. I will say that the professors can be a bit unclear towards what they want out of assignments which can make things stressful. Similarly, besides the class, it's really up to the students to find their own ways of immersion within the class which can also be difficult since you are in a new country.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: DIS was really fun! definitely recommend

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: This program is excellent.  Living in Madrid is amazing, the city is so rich with culture and history.  I learned so much inside and outside of the classroom.  The class itself is very interesting, all of our discussions and guest speakers discussed relevant and stimulating topics.  My Spanish speaking and comprehension wildly improved.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: This course is a great way to experience Madrid. Most of the time, you'll have lots of free time outside of class to explore the city and spend time with others in the program. The professors are really nice, but sometimes fussy about participation/nit-picky things. They're also really fun to be with during the excursions. Definitely get to know them, and try to participate in class. Also, there's ~2 free weekends, and you should definitely consider traveling Europe outside of class.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: This course is reading heavy, however, it is fun and enjoyable. You're in Madrid and get to explore the city and much more while learning history in Spanish. Try to speak as much Spanish as you can. Don't stop speaking it even if other people speak to you in English.Be aware that the professor has favorites.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: This course definitely made me think differently and explore ideas that I hadn't before. It's an interesting mix of the study abroad experience - while there are lots of assignments for class, there is still some freedom to explore Spain on your own. Sometimes, the work was a bit overwhelming, but overall the course was manageable. The class field trips are a blast and really give you a fuller look at Spain as a country (outside of just Madrid). The professors are supportive, there are so many ways of learning that they explore (movies, music, readings, museum trips, etc.), and the whole staff is great about giving suggestions and offering help whenever you need it. It's a great timeframe to go abroad without committing to a whole semester, and it gives you a really unique experience somewhere between being a visitor and a resident of Spain.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: By enrolling in this course, you will embark on an enlightening intellectual journey that extends beyond the surface-level understanding of Spanish culture and cuisine. The course delves into the authentic essence of what it means to be Spanish, exploring the intricate dynamics of migration and the diverse identities that shape Spain's social fabric.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Entering this study abroad program, I anticipated immersing myself in Spanish culture and cuisine. However, I soon discovered that our exploration went beyond surface-level understanding. We delved deep into the authentic essence of being Spanish, unveiling a fascinating tapestry of migration and diverse identities within Spain. Through this enlightening perspective, we engaged in thought-provoking discussions about Madrid's historical ties to slavery and the impact of the Franco regime. Moreover, I gained practical skills, such as effectively using social media platforms like Instagram to share my Spanish experiences through captivating narratives. Yet, the most impactful aspect of this course was its focus on identity and the struggles faced by immigrants from around the world as they search for their place within Spain's vibrant mosaic.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The instructors created an environment where the classroom was open to ideas. I never felt bad about raising my hand or stating comments in class because they were open and welcoming to everyones opinion. This made it easy to practice Spanish and think critically in another language without being judged. The class had light readings everyday so even while abroad there wasn't a heavy workload which allowed the class to feel manageable and fun.

excursions were fun!

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Personally, the small group break out time in class was super helpful. I feel like it got our creative juices flowing, allowed us to organize our thoughts, and made everyone engage more. I wish we did more things like that during our field trips (i.e. la parcería, espacio afro)

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: There were some amazing speakers who came in! I also think that the documentary about the amnesty policy and victims of crimes under Franco was fantastic. All of the excursions were great as well, as they allowed us to understand the history of th city while also connecting attractions in Madrid to the topic of global Spain.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The instructors encouraged us to the think about multiculturalism in Madrid and Spain in general.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The Instagram video project was a lovely way to engage creatively and critically with my study abroad experience. I would keep it but, perhaps, make it more of an individual, journal-like chronicle. Although I really liked working with my group (they were fantastic!), I think the project would have been a bit more impactful if it had been a reflection of my experiences and thoughts on Madrid. I also think the class visits to other Spanish cities and important locations around Madrid were incredibly important to my positive experience.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The learning environment in this class was exceptionally conducive to my educational journey, thanks to the instructors and the well-designed structure of the course. The instructors played a pivotal role in facilitating my learning by creating an engaging and inclusive atmosphere that encouraged active participation and critical thinking. One notable aspect of the course that greatly contributed to my learning was the incorporation of diverse course components. The combination of lectures, discussions guest speakers, and interactive activities allowed for a comprehensive exploration of the subject matter. The instructors skillfully curated a curriculum that balanced theoretical knowledge with real-world examples, fostering a deeper understanding of the topics at hand. Additionally, the course incorporated interactive methods of instruction, such as group projects and multimedia (instagram and video). These approaches not only made the learning experience more dynamic but also encouraged collaboration and the application of theoretical concepts to practical situations. By actively engaging with the material, I was able to develop a deeper level of comprehension and retain the information more effectively. Additionally, the professors fostered an atmosphere that encouraged students to express their thoughts and emotions openly, even if they were uncomfortable or conflicted. Through this approach, we were able to explore contrasting viewpoints and grapple with the complexities of the subject matter, deepening our understanding and promoting personal growth.The professors skillfully navigated through difficult and potentially controversial topics, such as the historical legacy of slavery in Madrid and the complex regime of Francisco Franco.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: This class is worth taking as a study abroad course because it was a nice balance of academic work but did not take over your entire experience. I will say that the professors can be a bit unclear towards what they want out of assignments which can make things stressful. Similarly, besides the class, it's really up to the students to find their own ways of immersion within the class which can also be difficult since you are in a new country.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: This course is a great way to experience Madrid. Most of the time, you'll have lots of free time outside of class to explore the city and spend time with others in the program. Definitely get to know them, and try to participate in class. Also, there's ~2 free weekends, and you should definitely consider traveling Europe outside of class.
